intro: Linanthus glaber, commonly known as the smooth flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually blue or violet in color and bloom in the summer months. Linanthus glaber is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
